parts.part1_statement:
PART 1: STATEMENT OF INTENT

The management of [COMPANY_NAME] is committed to:
- Providing a safe and healthy working environment
- Preventing accidents and work-related ill health
- Complying with all health and safety legislation
- Consulting with employees on health and safety matters
- Providing adequate resources for health and safety
- Continually improving health and safety performance

This policy applies to all employees, contractors, and visitors.

Signed: [CEO_NAME], Chief Executive
Date: [DATE]
Review date: [REVIEW_DATE]
parts.part2_organisation:
PART 2: ORGANISATION AND RESPONSIBILITIES

**Board of Directors:**
- Overall responsibility for health and safety
- Ensure adequate resources
- Review policy annually

**Chief Executive:**
- Implement policy
- Ensure compliance
- Report to Board

**Health and Safety Manager: [NAME]**
- Day-to-day management of H&S
- Risk assessments
- Incident investigation
- Training coordination
- Compliance monitoring

**Line Managers:**
- Implement policy in their areas
- Conduct risk assessments
- Ensure safe working practices
- Report hazards and incidents
- Provide training and supervision

**All Employees:**
- Take reasonable care for own and others' safety
- Cooperate with management on H&S
- Use equipment safely
- Report hazards, incidents, and near misses
- Not interfere with H&S measures
- Attend training

**Competent Person (Reg 7 MHSWR):** [NAME/EXTERNAL ADVISER]
- Provide expert H&S advice
- Assist with risk assessments and compliance
parts.part3_arrangements:
PART 3: ARRANGEMENTS

1. RISK ASSESSMENT:
- General risk assessments conducted and reviewed annually
- Specific assessments: COSHH, manual handling, DSE, fire, noise, young persons, new/expectant mothers
- Risk assessments recorded and communicated
- Control measures implemented

2. SAFE WORKING PROCEDURES:
- Safe systems of work for hazardous activities
- Permit-to-work for high-risk tasks
- Method statements for contractors

3. INFORMATION AND TRAINING:
- Induction training for all new employees
- Role-specific training
- Refresher training [annually]
- Records maintained

4. CONSULTATION:
- Health and Safety Committee meets [quarterly]
- Employee safety representatives appointed
- Toolbox talks and safety briefings

5. ACCIDENTS AND INCIDENTS:
- All accidents/incidents reported and recorded
- Investigation of accidents to prevent recurrence
- RIDDOR reporting to HSE (deaths, major injuries, >7 day absences, diseases)
- First aid provision: [NUMBER] trained first aiders

6. FIRE SAFETY:
- Fire risk assessment conducted
- Fire evacuation procedures and drills [frequency]
- Fire wardens appointed
- Fire detection and fighting equipment maintained
- Emergency lighting tested

7. WORKPLACE FACILITIES:
- Adequate welfare facilities (toilets, washing, drinking water, rest areas)
- Workplace temperature minimum 16°C (13°C for physical work)
- Adequate lighting and ventilation
- Cleanliness and housekeeping

8. WORK EQUIPMENT:
- Equipment suitable and maintained
- Guarding of dangerous parts
- Inspection and testing schedules
- PAT testing of electrical equipment

9. MANUAL HANDLING:
- Avoid hazardous manual handling where possible
- Risk assessment of manual handling tasks
- Training provided
- Mechanical aids available

10. DISPLAY SCREEN EQUIPMENT (DSE):
- DSE assessments for habitual users
- Workstation adjustments
- Eye tests available
- Breaks from screen work

11. PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE):
- PPE provided free where risk cannot be eliminated
- Training on correct use
- Maintenance and replacement

12. HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES (COSHH):
- Inventory of hazardous substances
- COSHH assessments
- Safety data sheets available
- Exposure controls
- Health surveillance where required

13. CONTRACTORS:
- Pre-qualification and competence checks
- Method statements and risk assessments required
- Induction and permit-to-work
- Monitoring and supervision

14. VISITORS:
- Sign in/out
- Safety briefing
- Escorted where necessary

15. MONITORING AND REVIEW:
- Regular inspections and audits
- Policy reviewed annually or after significant changes
- Performance monitored via KPIs (accident rates, near misses, training completion)
